H0.text: Their shapes stay the same in any container is the statement that correctly describes both gases and liquids.

H1.text: Their shapes change when they are in different containers is a statement that correctly describes both gases and liquids.

H2.text: Their volumes stay the same in any container is the correct statement describing both gases and liquids.

H3.text: Their volumes change when they are in different containers, correctly describing both gases and liquids.

A4.text: In physics, a fluid is a liquid, gas, or other material that may continuously move and deform (flow) under an applied shear stress, or external force.

A5.text: Compressible fluid: A fluid that causes volume reduction or density change when pressure is applied to the fluid or when the fluid becomes supersonic.

A6.text: A gas has no definite shape or volume, but occupies the entire container in which it is confined.

A7.text: This means that the shape of a liquid is not definite but is determined by its container.
